How to Install snapcraft-parser on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • snapcraft-parser

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install snapcraft-parser on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing snapcraft-parser on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall snapcraft-parser in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install snapcraft-parser, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install snapcraft-parser Using apt

To install snapcraft-parser in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install snapcraft-parser using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install snapcraft-parser

The installation of snapcraft-parser might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install snapcraft-parser Using apt-get

To install snapcraft-parser using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install snapcraft-parser.

sudo apt-get -y install snapcraft-parser

Install snapcraft-parser Using Synaptic

To install snapcraft-parser using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install snapcraft-parser on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for snapcraft-parser. This will display the snapcraft-parser package in the package window, now to install snapcraft-parser, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the snapcraft-parser package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of snapcraft-parser.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install snapcraft-parser Using aptitude

To install snapcraft-parser on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of snapcraft-parser.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install snapcraft-parser using the command aptitude install snapcraft-parser.

sudo aptitude -y install snapcraft-parser

How to Upgrade snapcraft-parser on debian

If you want to upgrade the snapcraft-parser package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade snapcraft-parser using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade snapcraft-parser to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade snapcraft-parser.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade snapcraft-parser sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade snapcraft-parser

Upgrade snapcraft-parser using Aptitude

To upgrade snapcraft-parser using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade snapcraft-parser.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade snapcraft-parser

Upgrade snapcraft-parser using Synaptic

To upgrade snapcraft-parser using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for snapcraft-parser, now right-click snapcraft-parser, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade snapcraft-parser just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall snapcraft-parser on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall snapcraft-parser from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just snapcraft-parser, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove snapcraft-parser

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of snapcraft-parser

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of snapcraft-parser you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge snapcraft-parser

Remove snapcraft-parser using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall snapcraft-parser using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for snapcraft-parser, right-click the snapcraft-parser package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall snapcraft-parser click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install snapcraft-parser on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade snapcraft-parser using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of snapcraft-parser then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
